fact_list.fact_text: Zig-zag lines by the side of the road give advance warning of the presence of a Pedestrian Crossing.
The white zig-zag lines indicate no stopping at all times on this road.
Vehicles should not overtake or wait in the vicinity of zig-zag lines.
Pedestrians are prohibited from crossing at the zig-zag areas.
Vehicles turning right at road junctions should stay within the pocket until it is clear to complete the turn.
Traffic calming markings consist of a series of triangular markings on the side of the road to create a visually narrowed road to encourage motorists to slow down.
Dashed pedestrian crossing lines provide better contrast with the stop line to better demarcate the crossing area for pedestrians.
Motorists should comply with the stop line for pedestrians to cross.
Pedestrian Crossing Ahead Markings warn motorists of Zebra Crossing ahead.
Motorists should watch out and give way to pedestrians at Zebra Crossings.
